00038 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00039 //  CLASS : sc_in_resolved
00040 //
00041 //  The sc_signal_resolved input port class.
00042 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00043 
00044 class SC_API sc_in_resolved
00045     : public sc_in<sc_dt::sc_logic>
00046 {
00047 public:
00048 
00049     // typedefs
00050 
00051     typedef sc_dt::sc_logic            data_type;
00052 
00053     typedef sc_in_resolved             this_type;
00054     typedef sc_in<data_type>           base_type;
00055 
00056     typedef base_type::in_if_type      in_if_type;
00057     typedef base_type::in_port_type    in_port_type;
00058     typedef base_type::inout_port_type inout_port_type;
00059 
00060 public:
00061 
00062     // constructors
00063 
00064     sc_in_resolved()
00065         : base_type()
00066         {}
00067 
00068     explicit sc_in_resolved( const char* name_ )
00069         : base_type( name_ )
00070         {}
00071 
00072     explicit sc_in_resolved( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00073         : base_type( interface_ )
00074         {}
00075 
00076     sc_in_resolved( const char* name_, const in_if_type& interface_ )
00077         : base_type( name_, interface_ )
00078         {}
00079 
00080     explicit sc_in_resolved( in_port_type& parent_ )
00081         : base_type( parent_ )
00082         {}
00083 
00084     sc_in_resolved( const char* name_, in_port_type& parent_ )
00085         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00086         {}
00087 
00088     explicit sc_in_resolved( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00089         : base_type( parent_ )
00090         {}
00091 
00092     sc_in_resolved( const char* name_, inout_port_type& parent_ )
00093         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00094         {}
00095 
00096     sc_in_resolved( this_type& parent_ )
00097         : base_type( parent_ )
00098         {}
00099 
00100     sc_in_resolved( const char* name_, this_type& parent_ )
00101         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00102         {}
00103 
00104 
00105     // destructor (does nothing)
00106 
00107     virtual ~sc_in_resolved()
00108         {}
00109 
00110 
00111     // called when elaboration is done
00112     /*  WHEN DEFINING THIS METHOD IN A DERIVED CLASS, */
00113     /*  MAKE SURE THAT THIS METHOD IS CALLED AS WELL. */
00114 
00115     virtual void end_of_elaboration();
00116 
00117     virtual const char* kind() const
00118         { return "sc_in_resolved"; }
00119 
00120 private:
00121 
00122     // disabled
00123     sc_in_resolved( const this_type& );
00124     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& );
00125 };

00128 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00129 //  CLASS : sc_inout_resolved
00130 //
00131 //  The sc_signal_resolved input/output port class.
00132 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00133 
00134 class SC_API sc_inout_resolved
00135     : public sc_inout<sc_dt::sc_logic>
00136 {
00137 public:
00138 
00139     // typedefs
00140 
00141     typedef sc_dt::sc_logic            data_type;
00142 
00143     typedef sc_inout_resolved          this_type;
00144     typedef sc_inout<data_type>        base_type;
00145 
00146     typedef base_type::in_if_type      in_if_type;
00147     typedef base_type::in_port_type    in_port_type;
00148     typedef base_type::inout_if_type   inout_if_type;
00149     typedef base_type::inout_port_type inout_port_type;
00150 
00151 public:
00152 
00153     // constructors
00154 
00155     sc_inout_resolved()
00156         : base_type()
00157         {}
00158 
00159     explicit sc_inout_resolved( const char* name_ )
00160         : base_type( name_ )
00161         {}
00162 
00163     explicit sc_inout_resolved( inout_if_type& interface_ )
00164         : base_type( interface_ )
00165         {}
00166 
00167     sc_inout_resolved( const char* name_, inout_if_type& interface_ )
00168         : base_type( name_, interface_ )
00169         {}
00170 
00171     explicit sc_inout_resolved( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00172         : base_type( parent_ )
00173         {}
00174 
00175     sc_inout_resolved( const char* name_, inout_port_type& parent_ )
00176         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00177         {}
00178 
00179     sc_inout_resolved( this_type& parent_ )
00180         : base_type( parent_ )
00181         {}
00182 
00183     sc_inout_resolved( const char* name_, this_type& parent_ )
00184         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00185         {}
00186 
00187 
00188     // destructor (does nothing)
00189 
00190     virtual ~sc_inout_resolved()
00191         {}
00192 
00193 
00194     // write the new value
00195 
00196     this_type& operator = ( const data_type& value_ )
00197         { (*this)->write( value_ ); return *this; }
00198 
00199     this_type& operator = ( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00200         { (*this)->write( interface_.read() ); return *this; }
00201 
00202     this_type& operator = ( const in_port_type& port_ )
00203         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00204 
00205     this_type& operator = ( const inout_port_type& port_ )
00206         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00207 
00208     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& port_ )
00209         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00210 
00211 
00212     // called when elaboration is done
00213     /*  WHEN DEFINING THIS METHOD IN A DERIVED CLASS, */
00214     /*  MAKE SURE THAT THIS METHOD IS CALLED AS WELL. */
00215 
00216     virtual void end_of_elaboration();
00217 
00218     virtual const char* kind() const
00219         { return "sc_inout_resolved"; }
00220 
00221 private:
00222 
00223     // disabled
00224     sc_inout_resolved( const this_type& );
00225 };

00228 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00229 //  CLASS : sc_out_resolved
00230 //
00231 //  The sc_signal_resolved output port class.
00232 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00233 
00234 // sc_out_resolved can also read from its port, hence no difference with
00235 // sc_inout_resolved. For debugging reasons, a class is provided instead
00236 // of a typedef.
00237 
00238 class SC_API sc_out_resolved
00239     : public sc_inout_resolved
00240 {
00241 public:
00242 
00243     // typedefs
00244 
00245     typedef sc_out_resolved            this_type;
00246     typedef sc_inout_resolved          base_type;
00247 
00248     typedef base_type::data_type       data_type;
00249 
00250     typedef base_type::in_if_type      in_if_type;
00251     typedef base_type::in_port_type    in_port_type;
00252     typedef base_type::inout_if_type   inout_if_type;
00253     typedef base_type::inout_port_type inout_port_type;
00254 
00255 public:
00256 
00257     // constructors
00258 
00259     sc_out_resolved()
00260         : base_type()
00261         {}
00262 
00263     explicit sc_out_resolved( const char* name_ )
00264         : base_type( name_ )
00265         {}
00266 
00267     explicit sc_out_resolved( inout_if_type& interface_ )
00268         : base_type( interface_ )
00269         {}
00270 
00271     sc_out_resolved( const char* name_, inout_if_type& interface_ )
00272         : base_type( name_, interface_ )
00273         {}
00274 
00275     explicit sc_out_resolved( inout_port_type& parent_ )
00276         : base_type( parent_ )
00277         {}
00278 
00279     sc_out_resolved( const char* name_, inout_port_type& parent_ )
00280         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00281         {}
00282 
00283     sc_out_resolved( this_type& parent_ )
00284         : base_type( parent_ )
00285         {}
00286 
00287     sc_out_resolved( const char* name_, this_type& parent_ )
00288         : base_type( name_, parent_ )
00289         {}
00290 
00291 
00292     // destructor (does nothing)
00293 
00294     virtual ~sc_out_resolved()
00295         {}
00296 
00297 
00298     // write the new value
00299 
00300     this_type& operator = ( const data_type& value_ )
00301         { (*this)->write( value_ ); return *this; }
00302 
00303     this_type& operator = ( const in_if_type& interface_ )
00304         { (*this)->write( interface_.read() ); return *this; }
00305 
00306     this_type& operator = ( const in_port_type& port_ )
00307         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00308 
00309     this_type& operator = ( const inout_port_type& port_ )
00310         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00311 
00312     this_type& operator = ( const this_type& port_ )
00313         { (*this)->write( port_->read() ); return *this; }
00314 
00315     virtual const char* kind() const
00316         { return "sc_out_resolved"; }
00317 
00318 private:
00319 
00320     // disabled
00321     sc_out_resolved( const this_type& );
00322 };
